page.title: 18TRANSPORT MOELFRE LIFEBOAT
page.content: {>Interview with the Lifeboat Coxswain The Coxswain was appointed in October 1972, he would like a Tyne class boat to the Rother class boat he has at present, as it would be bigger and faster. The Lifeboat went out last on June 22nd to search for two young canoeists lost off Cemaes Bay. The inshore boat carries out a lot of important rescue work in this area during the tourist season.The R.A.F. RESCUE HELICOPTER from Valley also works closely with the local Rescue Services. The grandson of the Emperor of Japan will be visiting the Lifeboat Station in July. Owen Roberts.
